product_description.product_definition: Portland cement is a hydraulic cement produced by pulverizing clinker, consisting essentially of crystalline hydraulic calcium silicates, and usually containing water, calcium sulfate, up to 5% limestone, and processing additions.
product_description.blended_cement: A hydraulic cement consisting of two or more inorganic constituents which contribute to the strength gaining properties of the cement.

types.Type IL: Portland-limestone cement with limestone content more than 5% but less than or equal to 15% by mass.
types.Type IP: Portland-pozzolan cement with pozzolan constituent up to 40% by mass.

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: All input/output data required were collected and included in the LCI modelling.
lca_information.data_collection: Gate-to-gate input/output flow data collected for limestone quarry, clinker production, and cement manufacture for 2019.
lca_information.allocation_rules: Recycling and recycled content are modeled using the cut-off rule.

data_quality_requirements.completeness: All relevant processes considered and modeled.
data_quality_requirements.reproducibility: Internal reproducibility possible; external not possible.
data_quality_requirements.transparency: Activity and LCI datasets disclosed in the project report.

recycled_materials_handling.recovered_materials: Fly ash, furnace bottom ash, bypass dust, mill scale, polluted soils, spent catalyst, aluminum oxide waste, silica fume, granulated blast furnace slag, iron rich waste, cement kiln dust (CKD), flue gas desulfurization (FGD) gypsum, and calcium fluoride rich waste.
recycled_materials_handling.secondary_fuels: Used tires, plastics, solvents, used oil and oily waste, coal/carbon waste, roofing asphalt, household refuse-derived waste and non-hazardous liquid waste.
